item.title: Report E-2024060273
item.description:
Report E-2024060273

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-10
  • City: SEEKONK
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 10, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1230 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 25-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Green Site Services Group (GSSG) to remediate the impacted site. GSSG personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024060185
item.description:
Report E-2024060185

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: WESTFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a pail that was slightly leaking from the side. Apparently when the pail had been loaded onto the trailer it was struck by a forkblade from a forklift slightly puncturing it consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.

item.title: Report E-2024060048
item.description:
Report E-2024060048

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: SHREWSBURY
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWO experienced a UN2582 Hydrex 3250 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct a tote transfer. Terminal personnel conducting initial cleanup of 1-gallon. Contractors arrived onsite and transferred the material from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with impacted pads and PPE into a cubic yard box. All rinse water used to decontaminate the tote and pump were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024050740
item.description:
Report E-2024050740

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: MANSFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HIGHWAY TRANSPORT CHEMICAL, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HT driver stated that once he hooked up to take his paper work to his tractor when he heard a popping sound. Driver also stated that the when he was opening the external valve the handle felt different and it felt like it was coming out further than it should so he stopped opening He went to the back of the trailer and noticed the external valve had came out completely. He then went and hit the emergency valve but product continued to flow out until it finally stopped. HT notified the customer o the spill and the operator returned to the unloading area where he saw the external valve on the ground. HT driver had some product on his clothes and face. He was taken to the hospital for observation. HT driver did not have his hard hat on or face shield at the time
